Posts.EditableText:
Hello! I apologize if this is asked elsewhere; I searched multiple times and couldn't find anything matching what I was looking for.
So I plan to start a game, and I will be working on both my PC and a laptop. If I do this while logged into my account, will my game sync between the two? Like if I work on my PC and make progress, then later want to open it up and continue on my laptop - is that an option? 

Thanks!
Posts.HTML:
Hello! I apologize if this is asked elsewhere; I searched multiple times and couldn't find anything matching what I was looking for.
So I plan to start a game, and I will be working on both my PC and a laptop. If I do this while logged into my account, will my game sync between the two? Like if I work on my PC and make progress, then later want to open it up and continue on my laptop - is that an option?

Thanks!

Posts.EditableText: Yes, if you are logged in and using the web version of the editor, then your game will be synced.
Posts.HTML: Yes, if you are logged in and using the web version of the editor, then your game will be synced.

Posts.EditableText:
Nice to have another person working with Squiffy!

Keep in mind:

1. When you save or upload your **Squiffy Code** syncs fairly instantly. Your **actual game** can take between a few minutes up to a whole day to sync. Players of your game will only see the older version before this happens.

2. The offline version has more utilities than the online version. (CSS, local media, especially). Bluevoss has posted some amazing work-arounds in the forum, however!
Posts.HTML:
Nice to have another person working with Squiffy!

Keep in mind:

  1. When you save or upload your Squiffy Code syncs fairly instantly. Your actual game can take between a few minutes up to a whole day to sync. Players of your game will only see the older version before this happens.

  2. The offline version has more utilities than the online version. (CSS, local media, especially). Bluevoss has posted some amazing work-arounds in the forum, however!
